IATSE Mourns James ‚ÄúTrapper‚Äù McEvoy, Crew Member Killed In ‚ÄúTragic Incident‚Äù On New Orleans Set
Source: Deadline    Published: 2025-11-04 16:29:00

By Katie Campione TV Reporter UPDATED with coroner confirmation and production information: A crew member was killed on the set of a New Orleans-area production on Monday, Deadline has confirmed. The cause of death for James ‚ÄúTrapper‚Äù McEvoy, a grip who was also a member of IATSE Local 478, has not yet been confirmed, but he is suspected to have died by electrocution. An autopsy was being conducted Tuesday morning at the Jefferson Parish Coroner's Office in Harvey, LA, about six miles south of New Orleans, a coroner's office spokesperson told Deadline. Sources tell Deadline that McEvoy was working on a feature film that was set to begin production on Tuesday, November 4. That production is believed to be Kill Me Now, an independent slasher thriller that was set to film in and around New Orleans from November 4 to December 5. Related Stories Executives Ken Ziffren Digs Into Warner Bros Discovery's "Pending Acquisition," Next Year's Guild Negotiations & Why Nielsen Should Be Investigated Executives Fifth Season's EVP Jill Arthur Departing Amid Layoffs Deadline has reached out to the production for comment. Watch on Deadline Several friends spoke of McEvoy's death in social media posts on Monday evening, one of whom said that he was killed in ‚Äúa tragic accident while working on set.‚Äù In the comments of that post, Deven Schruff, a NOLA locations manager whose recent credits include Sinners and Your Honor, also confirmed that McEvoy had died. ‚ÄúHeartbreaking, I have been so saddened by this news all day,‚Äù Schruff wrote. ‚ÄúHugs love and light to all of my film brothers and sisters. Praying for comfort for his family and all who loved our sweet Trapper.‚Äù In a statement to Deadline, IATSE affirmed that a crew member had died but did not disclose details about the victim, the accident, or the production on which it occurred. ‚ÄúToday we grieve the loss of one of our fellow members who was killed in a tragic incident on a production shooting in Louisiana,‚Äù IATSE International President Matt Loeb said in a statement. ‚ÄúOur deepest condolences are with the family who lost a loved one, and the crew who lost a friend and colleague. All workers have a right to safety on the job. We have engaged the Entertainment Community Fund to provide counseling for crew members, and are sending an IATSE representative to Louisiana to support the members and Local Unions on the ground there.‚Äù Deadline has reached out to IATSE Local 478 as well as the local film office. This post will be updated as more details are available. Denise Petski and Andreas Wiseman contributed to this report. Get our Breaking News Alerts and Keep your inbox happy. Comments On Deadline Hollywood are monitored. So don't go off topic, don't impersonate anyone, and don't get your facts wrong. Comment Name Email Website Œî What happened? Trapper's loss to the local film community is immeasurable. When the facts are laid out we need to act to ensure this never happens again. It's what Trapper would want and demand of us all. If something doesn't feel right on set use your voice and say no. There's nothing worth dying for on production. If it's in our power to control a situation then it must be. Take care of each other, and call your hall if something is unsafe. Our rules, and safety regulations are written in blood. I just never thought it would be his. Stay safe out there, and reach out to your local for grief support. just because something tragic and accidental happened doesn't mean you need to finger point and lay blame immediately that some faceless producer or production is at blame here. typical union and mob mentality. sometimes unfortunate and tragic things happen and not everything is a witch hunt to put some filmmakers head on a stake for it. RIP and prayers to his family. Like the other person said, electrocution sounds like faulty equipment and/or negligence. Also productions don't always have the greatest reputation for following proper safety protocols (like the Rust shooting). Accidents are tripping over a crack in the sidewalk. Dying of electrocution is not an accident. It's evidence of negligence on someone's part. Hopefully we will find out who did not do their job in keeping crew and the public safe. Lucy Hale, Jack Whitehall & Anjelica Huston Starring In Horror ‚ÄòLegacy' From ‚ÄòBlack Mirror' Director David Slade
Source: Deadline    Published: 2025-11-04 16:25:00

By Andreas Wiseman Executive Editor, International & Strategy EXCLUSIVE: Lucy Hale (Truth Or Dare), Jack Whitehall (Jungle Cruise) and Oscar winner Anjelica Huston (The Addams Family) have been set to star in horror film Legacy, which is currently in production in the UK. Genre veteran David Slade (Black Mirror: Bandersnatch) is directing the original screenplay from emerging writer Thomas Bilotta. Plot details are being kept under wraps, but the project is described as ‚Äúa harrowing 24 hours surrounding two siblings and the passing of their estranged father‚Äù. Chris Abernathy and Eric B. Fleischman's Wonder Company is producing. Executive producers include Hale, Amanda Massetti, Jo Henriquez, Jan McAdoo, Stephen Braun, Ross Putman, James Harris, Mark Lane and Bishal Dutta. Jess Varley and Bri Hennessey will co-ep. UTA Independent Film Group is representing domestic rights. Watch on Deadline Related Stories News Lucy Hale To Headline 'Dead Letters' Series Based On Book In Works At Netflix From Alex Cooper's Unwell & Kapital News Anjelica Huston Reveals Private Cancer Battle: "A Very Serious Moment" Slade is best known for directing movies Black Mirror: Bandersnatch, 30 Days Of Night, and The Twilight Saga: Eclipse as well as episodes of hit shows Black Mirror, Breaking Bad, and American Gods. Said Slade: ‚ÄúI'm excited to be bringing this project to life and am loving working with Lucy, Jack and Anjelica. The underlying universal themes of fatherhood and family bonds spoke to me and my own experience directly. The question of ‚Äòwhat would you do for your family?' always intrigues me as a question to pose to audiences.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe've been long-admirers of David's work and style, so this collaboration has been a very special process for us. David's ability to craft commercial genre films that garner massive fanbases is a rarity and we look forward to audiences experiencing the nightmares he's captured on film out here in the English countryside‚Äù, added Fleischman and Abernathy. Hale is repped by CAA and Reel Talent Management. Whitehall is repped by CAA and Independent Talent Group. Huston is repped by WME and Jaclyn Bashoff. Slade is rep'd by UTA, 42, and Casarotto. Watch the First Trailer for Nick Cave TV Adaptation The Death of Bunny Munro
Source: Pitchfork    Published: 2025-11-04 16:17:49

The first trailer is here for The Death of Bunny Munro, the Matt Smith‚Äìhelmed TV adaptation of Nick Cave's 2009 novel of the same name. The trailer shows Smith as the titular character, a door-to-door salesman who embarks on a debauched road trip with his young son while dealing with sex addiction and his wife's suicide. Scored by Cave and Warren Ellis, the six-part series arrives on Thursday, November 20. Writer Pete Jackson adapted the book, with Isabella Ekl√∂f directing; Sarah Greene stars as Munro's late wife, Libby, and Rafael Math√© makes his TV debut as his son. Cave and Smith executive-produced the series for Sky Original, which will present the series via Sky TV and the UK streaming service Now. ¬© 2025 Cond√© Nast. All rights reserved. Mary-Kate & Ashley Olsen Make Rare, Matching Appearance Together: VIDEO
Source: EntertainmentNow    Published: 2025-11-04 16:11:03

Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen thrilled their fans last night, November 3, by making a joint appearance in matching outfits at the 2025 CFDA (Council of Fashion Designers of America) Awards. The 39-year-old twins, famous for their iconic '90s and early 2000's videos such as ‚ÄúTo Grandmother's House We Go‚Äù and ‚ÄúNew York Minute,‚Äù skipped the red carpet, but appeared onstage together and made a speech to accept the American Accessory Designer of the Year award for their luxury brand The Row. Rihanna and A$AP Rocky also attended the ceremony, marking their first red carpet appearance since Rihanna gave birth their third child in September. See a video Mary-Kate and Ashley's speech at the 2025 CFDA awards below. The elusive twins, who have kept a super low profile since wrapping up their acting days, were photographed together this summer at their The Row store in the Hamptons. They were also seen side by side posing with Sara Moonves, the editor-in-chief of W Magazine, at New York Fashion Week in September. When Mary-Kate and Ashley stepped up to the microphone to accept their award, one of them thanked boutiques and individual buyers, saying, ‚ÄúYou have been our guiding light for the last 20 years now.‚Äù She also dedicated the award ‚Äúto our amazing customers, who truly give us the opportunity to do what we love.‚Äù She went on, ‚ÄúFrom the bottom of our hearts, thank you. And lastly, to our friends and family. Without your support, we would not be here today. So thank you for giving us the love and kindness that allows us to show up to work each day. The girls smiled at each other before carrying their trophy off stage. One of the twins' hair was loosely pulled back and tucked under her black coat, while the other wore her golden locks flowing around her shoulders. Women's Wear Daily says the Olsen twins beat out Ana Khouri, Catherine Holstein for Khaite, Raul Lopez for Luar and Tory Burch in the category for American Accessory Designer of the Year. Mary-Kate and Ashley became America's youngest sweethearts in their joint role as Michelle Tanner on ‚ÄúFull House,‚Äù a job they started in 1987 when they were just a year old. Afterwards, they released their own series of adorable sing-along videos before cornering the teen and tween market in films like ‚ÄúGetting There‚Äù and ‚ÄúHoliday In the Sun.‚Äù So why did they quit acting? Ultimately, they pivoted to fashion and seem hyper-focused on their high-end line, The Row. British Vogue says the brand, founded in 2006, allowed the young designers to ‚Äúbreak into the upper echelons of the luxury fashion sphere is a feat that few new brands achieve.‚Äù Why? We could have gone decades without thinking about them at all. Why ruin that for everyone by pushing PR pics? Comment Save my name, email, and website in this browser for the next time I comment. Another New AI Production Company Inks a Big Creative Partnership ‚Äî This Time, with Ron Howard and Brian Grazer's Imagine Entertainment
Source: IndieWire    Published: 2025-11-04 16:00:00

By providing your information, you agree to our Terms of Use and our Privacy Policy. We use vendors that may also process your information to help provide our services. This site is protected by reCAPTCHA Enterprise and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. Earlier this year, IndieWire shared a report that an enormous amount of AI production companies have launched within the last three years. Not all of those were created equal, but the ones that stand out ‚Äî and potentially have staying power in Hollywood ‚Äî have noticeably been backed by other major industry players. On Tuesday, November 4, Obsidian Studio announced its launch with a goal of blending live-action film projects with AI-powered digital production. And it will be kicking things off with a big name behind it, care of a creative partnership with Brian Grazer and Ron Howard's Imagine Entertainment. Obsidian co-founders Wes Walker and Louis Gheysens, in a conversation with IndieWire, said they'll be producing several long-form projects, including a feature film project, for Imagine and in partnership with Howard, with whom Walker developed a friendship over the last year. Obsidian has, throughout 2025, quietly been working with various brands, including Louis Vuitton, Longchamp, Crayola, Aramco, Amazon, NBA, and ESPN, but the partnership with Imagine will allow Obsidian to expand into original narrative projects. Related Stories ‚ÄòPredator: Badlands' Review: A Lovable Yautja Runt Teams Up with an Oscar-Worthy Elle Fanning in the Second Great ‚ÄòPredator' Movie of 2025 ‚ÄòH Is for Hawk' Trailer: Claire Foy Tries to Work Through Her Grief by Training the Maddest of All Birds ‚ÄúAdvertising moves at an incredibly rapid pace. This year we were really blessed to do really high budget, beautiful commercials. And the speed at which we move, the pace at which we're able to create, the openness to technology, the openness to try things, that's really what's incredible about advertising: we can really push boundaries together alongside some of the best teams in the world,‚Äù Walker said. ‚ÄúWe're taking and researching and studying what we're learning in advertising, bringing that into the entertainment space, and then using that to serve Imagine Entertainment projects.‚Äù ‚ÄúAt Imagine, we are committed to emotionally resonant, human storytelling and we have already seen the ways AI can be a beneficial tool in that mission. Obsidian's artist-led approach is exactly the kind of collaboration we stand behind to amplify human creativity and we're excited to be working with them,‚Äù said Justin Wilkes, President of Imagine Entertainment, in a statement. Obsidian has two proprietary tools it uses, one called EchoChrome that is designed to enhance image quality of low bit depth AI video and bring it into high-level VFX productions. Walker said, for campaigns for Cadillac and Mercedes, they've been able to incorporate AI into 3D volume stage backgrounds in order to blend live action and AI-generated CG. The other is called DigitalForge, and it refers to how Obsidian uses AI by integrating it into the production workflow. The company has recruited two storyboard artists, Marc Vena and Tani Kunitake, who have worked on films like ‚ÄúBlack Panther,‚Äù ‚ÄúLogan,‚Äù ‚ÄúStar Wars: The Last Jedi,‚Äù and more, and will train models based on their work to then build further worlds based on those creations. Walker describes being able to prompt AI ideas in real-time on set, to edit in real-time, and that ‚ÄúAI is not post; AI is production.‚Äù ‚ÄúOur approach is really about amplifying what artists can do, amplifying what DPs can do, amplifying what storyboard artists can do through the technology, and then creating worlds from that,‚Äù he said. Walker stresses that Imagine did not become fascinated with Obsidian's work just because of AI, but because of the work they're doing with VFX in other tools like Unreal Engine, Maya, Blender, and Houdini. He added that generative AI is not always the best tool for every project. ‚ÄúWe are artists working alongside artists. Everyone in the team is a high level artist, and we really believe that passionate, disciplined creatives are the world builders. We have the ability to to see,‚Äù Walker said. ‚ÄúThat in service of other directors is really where the magic happens for us as directors. We know what other directors go through. We know the struggles that they have in bringing their visions to life‚Ä¶ the tech and the tools don't matter. What matters is the audience experience. What matters next is the story and the emotion that the story is bringing about. And then we utilize the tech in service of that.‚Äù By providing your information, you agree to our Terms of Use and our Privacy Policy. We use vendors that may also process your information to help provide our services. This site is protected by reCAPTCHA Enterprise and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. By providing your information, you agree to our Terms of Use and our Privacy Policy. We use vendors that may also process your information to help provide our services. This site is protected by reCAPTCHA Enterprise and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.

Inside Kendall Jenner's extravagant beach bash celebrating 30th birthday: 818 Tequila, fireworks and more
Source: Page Six    Published: 2025-11-04 15:41:00

Blow out the Kandles! Kendall Jenner celebrated her 30th birthday with an extravagant beach bash featuring plenty of tequila and a massive firework display. The 818 Tequila founder was joined by her mom, Kris Jenner, and sisters Kim Kardashian, Khlo√© Kardashian and Kylie Jenner for her seaside soir√©e Monday night. Advertisement Kendall's fellow models, Hailey Bieber and Justine Skye, were also in tow. Advertisement Guests at the star-studded f√™te dressed to the nines in neutral tones, with the birthday girl opting for a pink and beige silk top paired with a cool geometric-print skirt. Kim, 45, went with a hip-hugging brown leather maxi, Kylie, 28, wore a little black dress, Khlo√©, 41, stunned in a pink halter gown and the momager, 69, showed off her curves in a sheer zebra-striped number. Advertisement The family members posed barefoot in front of a massive silver balloon display that spelled out ‚ÄúHappy Birthday Kendall,‚Äù and they also snapped a few fun selfies. Attendees commemorated Kendall's milestone birthday with shots of her 818 Tequila as well as a bottle of Chateau Haut-Brion French red wine from the model's birth year, 1995 (which retails for $595). Family and friends sang ‚ÄúHappy Birthday‚Äù to Kendall as she was presented with a beautiful, vintage-inspired white cake decorated with black bows, long candles and several mini bottles of 818 Tequila. Advertisement There was also a bonfire in the sand that was surrounded by chic Moroccan-style seating featuring cozy pillows, blankets and rugs, as well as twinkling string lights. Start your day with Page Six Daily. Please provide a valid email. By clicking above you agree to the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. Want celebrity news as it breaks? A beautiful show of fireworks exploded over the ocean to cap off the night. ‚ÄúHappy 30th Birthday @kendalljenner,‚Äù Kim wrote in a sweet Instagram post. ‚ÄúMay this decade bring you the kind of love and joy you so freely give to everyone else. ü§çI love you more than you'll ever understand! ‚ÄúHere's to 30 Kenny,‚Äù she added. Advertisement Khlo√© also raved about her ‚Äúbaby sister‚Äù in a lengthy tribute post. ‚ÄúI can't believe you're thirty. It feels impossible and yet, here you are; more radiant, grounded, and beautifully you than ever before,‚Äù the Good American founder wrote. Advertisement ‚ÄúSomething I've always admired and respected about you is how deeply and unapologetically you live in your truth,‚Äù she continued. ‚ÄúIn a world where so many try to fit in or please others, you've always just been yourself. Effortlessly, courageously, authentically YOU.‚Äù Kendall thanked her loved ones for celebrating with her by posting an Instagram Story photo of herself dancing in front of the fireworks, writing, ‚ÄúThank you for all the birthday love.‚Äù It's unclear if Kendall's other siblings, Kourtney Kardashian and Rob Kardashian, were at the event, though they weren't seen in any photos.

Effortlessly, courageously, authentically YOU.‚Äù Kendall thanked her loved ones for celebrating with her by posting an Instagram Story photo of herself dancing in front of the fireworks, writing, ‚ÄúThank you for all the birthday love.‚Äù It's unclear if Kendall's other siblings, Kourtney Kardashian and Rob Kardashian, were at the event, though they weren't seen in any photos.

Seth Meyers responds to being called a "deranged lunatic" by President Trump
Source: AV Club    Published: 2025-11-04 15:32:00

On Monday's episode of Late Night With Seth Meyers, the host took a Closer Look at President Donald Trump's obsessive bathroom renovation, completed while the government is shut down and millions of Americans are about to lose their SNAP benefits. That issue matters, Meyers said, adding, ‚ÄúWhat matters far less is when the president posts about me, which he did over the weekend, saying among other things that I ‚Äòmay be the least talented person to perform live in the history of television,' calling me a ‚Äòderanged lunatic,' and commenting that I ‚Äòtalked endlessly about electric catapults on aircraft carriers.‚Äù Nevertheless, the Saturday Night Live alum took a little time to address Trump's petty post. ‚ÄúLook, in general, I try to live by the New Yorker's creed: When someone is ranting and raving about you, ignore them. Chances are, they're just going to move on and rave about something else. But there's one thing I simply have to address,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúYou can say I'm untalented. You can say I'm deranged. But I'm not the one who talks endlessly about catapults on aircraft carriers!‚Äù Cue clips of Trump speaking engagements going back to 2019 talking about the catapults‚Äîit seems he's almost as obsessed with catapults as he is with bathroom renovations. ‚ÄúUntil you said something, I didn't even know aircraft carriers had catapults,‚Äù Meyers said indignantly. The host acknowledged that Trump's insults and complaints about the show (which included that Meyers' criticism is ‚ÄúPROBABLY ILLEGAL!!!‚Äù) are protected as a first amendment right‚Äî‚ÄùWhich I have too, right? We all have it, right?‚Äù Meyers double-checked. He noted that the president's recent post claimed he had just watched Late Night for the first time in ‚Äúyears,‚Äù when 10 months ago Trump posted that he ‚Äúgot stuck‚Äù watching the show for the first time in ‚Äúmonths.‚Äù If there's something that obsesses Trump more than bathrooms and catapults, it's his enemies in the media. ‚ÄúI say this with sincerity, I don't wanna talk about catapults. I don't wanna talk about bathrooms. And I'm realizing that I'm starting to sound like a deranged lunatic, but that's what you do to us. You make us talk about what you're talking about, and then we all sound crazy,‚Äù Meyers said. ‚ÄúBut what we should be talking about instead is the government shutdown you're not solving or the food assistance you refuse to fund. Working families are struggling while you renovate your bathroom and you build your ballroom and that's why your approval ratings are in the toilet.‚Äù Ôªø GET A.V.CLUB RIGHT IN YOUR INBOX Pop culture obsessives writing for the pop culture obsessed. Tom Brady admits dog Junie is a clone of ‚Äòbeloved' late pet Lua: Our ‚Äòsecond chance'
Source: Page Six    Published: 2025-11-04 15:22:00

Tom Brady's ‚Äúbeloved‚Äù dog Lua died in 2023 ‚Äî and the canine's blood was used to make a clone. On Tuesday, the retired NFL player revealed his new dog Junie's origins in a joint statement with Colossal Biosciences, with whom he worked to clone Lua. The former quarterback, who is an investor in the company, gushed over the ‚Äúsecond chance‚Äù his family has with Junie, according to People. Advertisement ‚ÄúI love my animals. They mean the world to me and my family,‚Äù the ex-athlete, 48, explained. ‚ÄúA few years ago, I worked with Colossal and leveraged their non-invasive cloning technology through a simple blood draw of our family's elderly dog before she passed.‚Äù Advertisement Brady's reveal comes as Colossal Biosciences acquires Viagen Pets and Equine, the company that twice cloned Barbra Streisand's dead dog Samantha, as well as Paris Hilton's missing dog Diamond Baby. ‚Äú[I'm] excited how Colossal and Viagen's tech together can help both families losing their beloved pets while helping to save endangered species,‚Äù the former New England Patriots player concluded. We already miss her sooooo much! #unconditionallove RIPLua üíî.‚Äù Advertisement Brady, for his part, wrote, ‚ÄúWe love you Lua, RIP.‚Äù In a separate Instagram Story post, the Fox Sports commentator added that the ‚Äúsweetest and cutest‚Äù canine would be ‚Äúforever in [their] hearts.‚Äù He and B√ºndchen both shared sweet snaps of Lua with their two kids, Benjamin, 15, and Vivian, 12. Bob Dylan Accepts Honorary Doctorate From Berklee College of Music
Source: Rolling Stone    Published: 2025-11-04 15:16:31

By Andy Greene Bob Dylan has accepted an honorary Doctor of Music degree from the Berklee College of Music, marking the first time he's received such an honor from an American college or university since 1970. ‚ÄúThank you, Berklee College of Music, for bestowing on me this prestigious honor. What a pleasant surprise,‚Äù Dylan says in a statement. ‚ÄúWho knows what path my career might have taken if I'd been fortunate enough to learn from some of the great musicians who taught at Berklee. It's something to think about.‚Äù The school says that they are recognizing Dylan's ‚Äúextraordinary influence on modern music‚Äù and ‚Äúlifelong commitment to creative exploration.‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is an incredible moment for this institution,‚Äù said Berklee President Jim Lucchese. ‚ÄúBob Dylan's music has shaped how the world hears itself. He's an artist who has never stopped evolving, who keeps chasing truth through sound and language. That's the spirit we try to cultivate here every day. Honoring him feels like a reaffirmation of the creative impulse that built this place.‚Äù Adds Berklee's American Roots Music Program artistic director Matt Glaser: ‚ÄúBob Dylan has spent a lifetime learning, absorbing, and transforming every American song tradition, and Berklee strives to teach all the music that Dylan loves. His deep immersion in African American blues parallels much of Berklee's curriculum, which is rooted in the distinctly American variants of the music of the African diaspora.‚Äù Popular on Rolling Stone ‚ÄúAs anyone who has read his books or listened to his hundred-plus radio programs can attest, Dylan is also a great teacher and learner,‚Äù Glaser continues. ‚ÄúHe shows us how to keep learning about music and the arts our whole lives through, and to embrace it all as one thing. I love the anecdote Dylan himself tells: he once went up to Thelonious Monk at the Five Spot in Greenwich Village, introduced himself, and said, ‚ÄòI play folk music down the street.' Monk replied, ‚ÄòWe all play folk music.'‚Äù Editor's picks The 250 Greatest Albums of the 21st Century So Far The 100 Best TV Episodes of All Time Dylan dropped out of the University of Minnesota in 1959 after spending just one semester on campus, where he barely attended any classes. He accepted an honorary degree from Scotland's University of St. Andrews in 2004, but hasn't received one from an American education institution since Princeton awarded him one in 1970. Dylan attended the ceremony in person alongside David Crosby, inspiring his 1970 New Morning song ‚ÄúDay of the Locusts.‚Äù (The event took place while cicadas were swarming the campus.) ‚ÄúOh, the benches were stained with tears and perspiration,‚Äù Dylan wrote in the song. ‚ÄúThe birdies were flying from tree to tree/There was little to say, there was no conversation/As I stepped to the stage to pick up my degree/And the locusts sang off in the distance/Yeah, the locusts sang such a sweet melody/Oh, the locusts sang off in the distance/Yeah, the locusts sang and they were singing for me.‚Äù Trending Stories Bad Company Are No Longer Reuniting for Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Performance Grateful Dead Singer Donna Jean Godchaux Dead at 78 AC/DC Extend ‚ÄòPower Up' Tour With 2026 Dates Late-Night Hosts Take Aim at Trump's ‚ÄòGatsby' Party: ‚ÄòAs Dumb as You'd Expect' In his 2004 memoir Chronicles, Dylan looked back on the day. ‚ÄúI was glad to get the degree, though,‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúI could use it. The very look and touch and scent of it spelled respectability and had something of the spirit of the universe in it. After whispering and mumbling my way through the ceremony, I was handed the scroll. We piled back into the big Buick and drove away.‚Äù This time around, there are no plans for Dylan to appear at any event commemorating the honorary degree from Berklee. But the school is staging a concert on Wednesday evening entitled Watching the River Flow: A Roots Salute to Bob Dylan. It will features students, faculty, alumni, and visiting artists performing Dylan classics like ‚ÄúBlowin' in the Wind, ‚ÄúThe Times They Are A-Changin',‚Äù and ‚ÄúChimes of Freedom.‚Äù It will culminate in a unique rendition of ‚ÄúIt's Alright, Ma (I'm Only Bleeding)‚Äù where a hand-selected group of students will take turns singing each of the 20 verses. We want to hear it. Send us a tip using our anonymous form. Rolling Stone is a part of Penske Media Corporation. ¬© 2025 Rolling Stone, LLC. All rights reserved.

Cat Power has announced a 20th anniversary tour of The Greatest, where she will play the album in full. Along with a massive run through North America and Europe, a new EP, Redux, is pegged to the album's anniversary. Comprising covers of James Brown's ‚ÄúTry Me‚Äù and Prince's ‚ÄúNothing Compares 2 Us,‚Äù as well as a reimagining of the Greatest track ‚ÄúCould We,‚Äù Redux arrives digitally and on 10" vinyl on January 23, 2026, via Domino. Listen to the James Brown cover below, and scroll down to find the dates. Chan Marshall recorded the new EP with Dirty Delta Blues, the group comprising guitarist Judah Bauer, keyboardist Gregg Foreman, bassist Erik Paparozzi, and drummer Jim White (of Dirty Three). The band's arrangement of ‚ÄúCould We‚Äù on the original tour behind The Greatest is the basis for the new recording. All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. 'Sexiest Man Alive' Jonathan Bailey's Relationship History: From Rumored Boyfriend to Private Love Life
Source: EntertainmentNow    Published: 2025-11-04 14:59:05

Jonathan Bailey, People's newly crowned ‚ÄúSexiest Man Alive,‚Äù has had a huge few years. The British actor stole hearts as Anthony Bridgerton on Netflix's ‚ÄúBridgerton,‚Äù starred as Fiyero in 2024's ‚ÄúWicked,‚Äù and will return this November in the sequel, ‚ÄúWicked: For Good.‚Äù Off-screen, Bailey has opened up about love, being ‚Äúproudly gay,‚Äù and what it means to live authentically while guarding his private life. Bailey is famously private about who he's dating, but he's shared glimpses over the years. In 2019, The Mirror reported that he was spotted kissing advertising executive James Ellis before the Olivier Awards, where he later won Best Actor in a Supporting Role. The two were seen together again in 2021 but never confirmed a relationship. In 2023, Bailey told The Evening Standard he was in a relationship but wouldn't share details. ‚ÄúThere's a lovely man,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt's not secret, but it's private. Having a private life is, for me, completely critical. I don't know if I would be able to be as confident to speak out on other things if I felt that my whole life was up for grabs.‚Äù Bailey has also been candid about what it took to be open about his sexuality. ‚ÄúOf course I thought that in order to be happy I needed to be straight,‚Äù he told GQ in 2022. ‚ÄúI reached a point where I thought, (expletive) this, I'd much prefer to hold my boyfriend's hand in public or be able to put my own face picture on Tinder and not be so concerned about that than getting a part.‚Äù At the 2019 Olivier Awards, Bailey used his acceptance speech to talk about representation. ‚ÄúAt a time where acknowledging the very existence of LGBTQ people in our schools is being questioned, we have been able to show a lovely and celebratory snapshot of gay love,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThat LGBTQ people really aren't that different.‚Äù Now 36, Bailey continues to balance fame and privacy. In a 2025 British Vogue interview, he admitted he's been thinking about fatherhood. ‚ÄúYes, it's such a privilege for a man,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúBut I can't bring children into my lifestyle now. I want to make sure I'm going to be present. I'm reading books on adoption. I might coparent with a woman, but I'm thinking it will be with a man.‚Äù Scarlett Johansson and Bailey are cozy costars. The British actor, 37, and the Marvel star, 40, appeared together at the New York premiere of their movie ‚ÄúJurassic World Rebirth‚Äù on June 23, alongside castmates Mahershala Ali and Rupert Friend. Johansson and Bailey turned heads when they shared a quick peck on the lips before posing for photographers. When asked about the moment, Bailey told Entertainment Tonight, ‚ÄúI believe in being able to show love in all different ways. And if you can't kiss your friends‚Ä¶ life's too short not to.‚Äù In an interview with The Hollywood Reporter, Bailey reflected on his role in the film and what it means to headline such a major project as an out gay actor. ‚ÄúThere's moments where, yes, you have to be excellent to prove that you can do it,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd it's not like I haven't felt that. There's the weight of history. And there's endless brilliant people who have come before you who have changed the way that people see sexuality.‚Äù He continued, ‚ÄúAny sort of sense of prejudice against sexuality is something to fight against, and what better way to do that than to go and play any kind of character. Being an out gay actor, historically, meant that you wouldn't be able to play straight and there weren't any gay parts to play anyway. That's obviously changed massively.‚Äù Comment Save my name, email, and website in this browser for the next time I comment. Œî Previous Next Like EntertainmentNow? Creator Camp and the Three-Picture Theatrical Deal: Attend Is Betting the Internet Can Fill Movie Screens
Source: IndieWire    Published: 2025-11-04 14:30:00

By providing your information, you agree to our Terms of Use and our Privacy Policy. We use vendors that may also process your information to help provide our services. This site is protected by reCAPTCHA Enterprise and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. Most creator projects still live (and die) online. Creator Camp wants to change that. The Austin-based creator collective distribution arm, Camp Studios, signed a three-picture theatrical deal with Attend Theatrical Marketplace, the Fithian Group company that connects filmmakers directly with movie theaters, streamlining the process of booking and releasing films. The first title, rom-com ‚ÄúTwo Sleepy People,‚Äù opens November 14 in 20 markets. It's directed by Baron Ryan, who co-wrote it with Caroline Grossman; they both star. (More here.) The premise is very TikTok-adjacent: Two distant co-workers wake up every morning as strangers, but every night they're married. Related Stories ZCON Is Where All the Executives Want to Be, but the Creators Are in Control How Did ‚ÄòF*ck My Son!' Become an Indie Hit? The Goalposts Moved The real bet is if creators already know their audience, why can't that audience show up to a cinema? Creator Camp says its network of 300 digital-native filmmakers accounts for over 3B annual views. They've already been pressure-testing theatrical demand: the film premiered at Creator Camp's flagship Austin event, where 1,000 attendees generated $150,000 in ticket sales. A four-city micro-tour followed in Seattle, Los Angeles, San Francisco and New York, averaging $10,429 per screen. Attend is led by NATO veterans Jackie Brenneman, John Fithian, and Patrick Corcoran, with the ambition to use data and AI to directly match films with theaters and audiences. So, in theory: Attend wants to make theatrical distribution transactional and demand-based; Creator Camp has creators who can actually deliver audiences. ‚ÄúToday's filmmakers grew up online and they understand their audiences because they engage with them constantly, which has allowed them to build massive, loyal communities,‚Äù said Creator Camp founder and CEO Max Reisinger. ‚ÄúThat direct connection solves a huge challenge in theatrical distribution. Instead of relying on outdated models that guess who will show up, our creators can bring fans to theaters they've already cultivated online, turning digital engagement into real-world box office success.‚Äù Brenneman sees it as smart math. ‚ÄúMovie theaters are vital places for community. When the movies are there, so are audiences. In partnership with the innovative approach of Creator Camp, we can build on the enthusiastic followers of filmmakers online, connect them directly to theaters, and with Attend create demand-driven theatrical releases.‚Äù For all the existential dread around the theatrical business, it's a forward-looking model that relies on conversion and community. That's a little different from ‚Äúfinding an audience‚Äù; it's believing that the audience is already here; you just need to point them at a screen. It suggests that the future of filmmaking might not be ‚Äúonline vs theatrical‚Äù; it could be online to theatrical, when the community wants it. ‚ÄúTwo Sleepy People‚Äù opens November 14; more markets are contingent on demand signals. Tickets and theater requests at twosleepypeople.com. By providing your information, you agree to our Terms of Use and our Privacy Policy. We use vendors that may also process your information to help provide our services. This site is protected by reCAPTCHA Enterprise and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. By providing your information, you agree to our Terms of Use and our Privacy Policy. We use vendors that may also process your information to help provide our services. This site is protected by reCAPTCHA Enterprise and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.

Ariana Grande 'Beyond Devastated' to Miss Brazil 'Wicked: For Good' Premiere Due to Flight Delays
Source: Rolling Stone    Published: 2025-11-04 13:59:01

By Larisha Paul Wicked: For Good will begin its global premiere tour in S√£o Paulo, Brazil, later this evening. It kicks off a run that will include stops in Paris, London, Singapore, and New York, leading up to the film's Nov. 21 theatrical release date. But the momentous opening will be without one of its stars. Ariana Grande will miss the premiere due to flight delays, she shared on Instagram. ‚ÄúI can't believe this is happening and I am beyond devastated to be sending this message,‚Äù Grande wrote. The singer and actress ‚Äî who leads as Glinda in the film ‚Äî boarded a plane with her team last night, but they were told to deplane for maintenance reasons with the crew citing safety concerns. This delayed the flight until 11 a.m., leaving insufficient time to make it to the premiere. ‚ÄúMy team and Universal have tried every single thing possible to fix this, we've searched every other flight, overnight, early morning, connecting flights, commercial and also private options and absolutely nothing was available or possible that would get us there in time,‚Äù Grande said. ‚ÄúEven in attempting a private option, there is a permit necessary in order to fly from here that takes time to attain.‚Äù Grande will make her first appearance on the premiere tour in Paris on Nov. 7, while the rest of the cast, including Cynthia Erivo and Jonathan Bailey, will ensure that the show goes on in Brazil in her absence. ‚ÄúI am so heartbroken that i'm unable to be there with you all,‚Äù Grande said. ‚ÄúWe sincerely tried everything we could and I apologize from the bottom of my heart. Please shower my incredible castmates with all of the love that I wish I could be showering you with and have the most beautiful celebration. And again, I am so, so very sorry.‚Äù Brazil's famously passionate pop fans voiced their disappointment online, but some remarks pushed Grande to release a second statement a few hours after the first. ‚ÄúPlease don't wish danger on us,‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúWe did everything we could and I promise you no one is more upset than I am, I promise. No matter how upset or disappointed you are, please please do not wish danger on us or assume that we didn't try.‚Äù Editor's picks The 250 Greatest Albums of the 21st Century So Far The 100 Best TV Episodes of All Time The 500 Greatest Albums of All Time 100 Best Movies of the 21st Century Last week, the Federal Aviation Administration shared reports on extensive understaffing at airports and air traffic control centers, per the New York Times. Employees at these locations have been working without pay for the duration of the government shutdown that began over a month ago. The shortage has led to delays and stress that the head of the air traffic controllers' union said ‚Äúmakes the system less safe.‚Äù Trending Stories Bad Company Are No Longer Reuniting for Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Performance Grateful Dead Singer Donna Jean Godchaux Dead at 78 AC/DC Extend ‚ÄòPower Up' Tour With 2026 Dates Late-Night Hosts Take Aim at Trump's ‚ÄòGatsby' Party: ‚ÄòAs Dumb as You'd Expect' Grande reminded upset fans that her flight plans for the premiere of a multi-million dollar film were not scheduled on a whim. ‚ÄúThere was no other time for me to leave and these plans have been booked for months,‚Äù she wrote. Grande noted that she wrapped filming on the upcoming Meet the Parents sequel, Focker In-Law, on Oct. 31, then spent Nov. 1 and 2 working, just as Erivo, Bailey, and Wicked director Jon M. Chu did. ‚ÄúWe were all scheduled to leave the same day,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt just so happened that this plane had a safety problem and I have explained why finding another option was impossible. I have been looking forward to this moment for a year, so please know how disappointed I am. Sending lots of love to you all. I hope it's a beautiful and safe night. I love Brazil, I always have, I always will.‚Äù We want to hear it. Send us a tip using our anonymous form. Rolling Stone is a part of Penske Media Corporation. ¬© 2025 Rolling Stone, LLC. Bad Company's Paul Rodgers Sitting Out Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Induction
Source: Billboard    Published: 2025-11-04 13:37:06

The news came days after original drummer Simon Kirke enthused about reuniting with Rodgers at Saturday's (Nov. 8) 2025 event. By Gil Kaufman With just days to go before this year's induction ceremony, one of the 2025 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductees has sent his regrets. Bad Company singer Paul Rodgers posted a note on the band's socials on Monday (Nov. 3) revealing that his ill health will prevent him from participating. Bad Company are slated to be inducted into the Rock Hall this weekend at the Peacock Theater in Los Angeles alongside Chubby Checker, Joe Cocker, Cyndi Lauper, OutKast, Soundgarden and The White Stripes in the Performer category and Salt-N-Pepa and Warren Zevon for Musical Influence. But, just days after the other surviving original member of the English rock supergroup ‚Äì fellow former Free member drummer Simon Kirke ‚Äî revealed that the two planned to reunite to play two songs on Saturday, Rodgers said he cannot participate. ‚ÄúMy hope was to be at the Rock & Rock Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony and to perform for the fans, but at this time I have to prioritize my health,‚Äù Rodgers, 75, said in a statement without providing any additional information on his condition. ‚ÄúI have no problem singing, it's the stress of everything else. Thanks for understanding. Simon along with some outstanding musicians will be stepping in for me ‚Äì guaranteed to rock.‚Äù Rodgers, Kirke, late guitarist Mick Ralphs and late bassist Boz Burrell will be inducted this weekend for their roles in the 1970s rock juggernaut whose biggest hits include ‚ÄúBad Company‚Äù and ‚ÄúCan't Get Enough‚Äù (1974), ‚ÄúFeel Like Makin' Love‚Äù and ‚ÄúShooting Star‚Äù (1975) and ‚ÄúRock ‚Äòn' Roll Fantasy‚Äù (1979) among others. The group originally split in 1982 and have reunited several times over the years in a variety of configurations to tour and record albums, last performing together in 2019. But in 2023, Kirke said the band was likely done due to a variety of health issues suffered by Rodgers over the past few years, with the singer revealing to CBS Mornings that year that he'd suffered two major strokes ‚Äî one in 2016 and another in 2019 ‚Äî as well as 11 minor strokes. This year's RRHOF induction ceremony will stream live coast-to-coast on Disney+ Saturday (Nov. 8), at 8 p.m. ET, and will be available to stream following the ceremony. ABC will also air a primetime special with performance highlights and standout moments on Jan. 1, at 8 p.m. ET, available the next day on Hulu. This year's event will feature an impressive list of performers and presenters, including: Beck, Brandi Carlile, David Letterman, Doja Cat, Elton John, Flea, Iggy Pop, J.I.D, Killer Mike, Maxwell, Missy Elliott, Olivia Rodrigo, Questlove, RAYE, Sleepy Brown, Taylor Momsen, Teddy Swims and Twenty One Pilots. Get weekly rundowns straight to your inbox A daily briefing on what matters in the music industry Send us a tip using our anonymous form. A daily briefing on what matters in the music industry Send us a tip using our anonymous form. Billboard is a part of Penske Media Corporation. ¬© 2025 Billboard Media, LLC. All Rights Reserved.

Coca-Cola Is Trying Another AI Holiday Ad. Executives Say This Time Is Different
Source: The Hollywood Reporter    Published: 2025-11-04 12:01:22

Subscribe for full access to The Hollywood Reporter Subscribe for full access to The Hollywood Reporter After a major backlash in 2024, Coke and the L.A. studio it hired have produced a new synthetic spot they believe viewers will like a lot more; "The craftsmanship is ten times better." Will they? By Steven Zeitchik Senior Editor, Technology and Politics For a few weeks last November, no villain loomed larger over Madison Avenue and the social media that polices it than Coca-Cola. The company's ‚ÄúThe Holidays Are Coming‚Äù spot, an homage to a classic 1995 ad, featured the original's rhythmic anthem as trucks drove through various snowy landscapes. Only now the ad was filled with AI-generated objects, animals and people ‚Äî a fact that did not go over well with creatives and many others on the Internet. ‚ÄúCoca-Cola is red because it's made from the blood of out-of-work artists,‚Äù decried Hollywood writer Alex Hirsch, one of many such negative comments noting both the spot's labor ethics and its aesthetics. (Despite or because of the backlash, the ad racked up billions of impressions.) Related Stories Movies Paul Schrader Has a "Perfect Script" for First Movie Made Only With AI: "We're Two Years Away" Business Is Netflix a Friend or Foe to AI? On Monday, Coke is trying again, releasing a new generative AI holiday ad with the globe-trucking concept. Once more, the company has hired the Los Angeles-based AI studio Secret Level to produce the spot. This time, though, the ad features just animals ‚Äî the only person seen is a Santa Claus at the end, based on the company's original drawings. (Coca-Cola inaugurated the modern depiction of Santa.) The company believes enough has changed in a year, in both the tech and society, to evoke a different response. ‚ÄúLast year people criticized the craftsmanship. But this year the craftsmanship is ten times better,‚Äù Pratik Thakar, global vp and head of generative AI at Coca-Cola, tells The Hollywood Reporter. ‚ÄúThere will be people who criticize ‚Äî we cannot keep everyone 100 percent happy,‚Äù he adds. ‚ÄúBut if the majority of consumers see it in a positive way it's worth going forward.‚Äù In a culture where Hollywood creators worry about an AI takeover while a video-watching citizenry braces itself for a wave of synthetic media from Sora 2 and others, an AI commercial at this level is no small thing. Coca-Cola is one of the world's most dominant brands and the holidays one of Madison Avenue's sacred human spaces. The unleashing of a spot by the former into the space of the latter could prove a litmus test for consumers' appetite for AI video ‚Äî while also, perhaps, further normalizing its consumption. The ad features the now-famous Coca-Cola trucks driving through different locales as animals from seals to pandas look on, suggesting a globetrotting trip. It ends as a truck door swings open and Santa appears. The image of the icon was generated exclusively by the archival paintings of Haddon Sundblom which the Coca-Cola company owns; the artist in the 1930s created the original Coke ads for The Saturday Evening Post that gave rise to our conception of the mythic St. Nicholas as a girthful bearded man in a red-and-white suit. While the current generation of AI videos can often take on a disconcertingly stylized quality, Coca-Cola sought to lean into that bug by choosing to portray not people but anthropomorphic animals, which they say they couldn't do before. ‚ÄúLast year it was difficult to get those expressions from animals so we had to use human faces. Now technology has evolved to where we can,‚Äù Thakar says. The desired effect is that of a Madagascar or other modern CG animated movie. Those films use artists working from scratch instead of the approach here, in which a model trained on thousands of earlier images generates, with human prompting and shaping, the animation in question. Jason Zada, Secret Level's founder and chief creative officer, says he hopes viewers cannot distinguish this spot from a traditional Hollywood animated movie. ‚ÄúThe best compliment I get is when people say a video doesn't look like AI,‚Äù he tells THR. The company used several Large Language Models to generate the creative. (Two other versions of the ‚Äúholidays are coming‚Äù ad were also made this year, an AI one with another studio, Silverside, and a traditionally shot one without the stylized animals, for some Latin markets.) AI is a perhaps unexpected focus for Coke, given the company's history of playing with a kind of schmaltzy humanism in its marketing. In addition to the Sundblom Santa paintings, which also had the rosy-cheeked character holding a Coke bottle in the likes of Ladies Home Journal and the New Yorker, the company is of course famous for its 1971 ‚ÄúI'd Like to Buy the World a Coke‚Äù ad, in which a panoply of people from different backgrounds stand atop a mountain singing. Thakar says Coca-Cola is going through a ‚Äúmajor marketing transformation, a companywide transformation‚Äù with AI at the center of the effort. The company was indeed one of the first to use the tech in a major ad when in 2023 it released ‚ÄúMasterpiece,‚Äù which brought the subjects of museum paintings to life catching and tossing Coke bottles, in creative that did not cause the backlash of last year's holiday spot. Zada believes social media gives a skewed impression of how some AI ads are going over. ‚ÄúThe haters on the Internet are the loudest, he says. ‚ÄúA lot of the people complaining last year were from the creative industry who were just afraid ‚Äî afraid for their jobs, afraid for what it did. But I think the spot tested really well and average people really enjoyed it.‚Äù Zada says labor fears are misplaced; while the Coke ad this year required fewer people to make it ‚Äî he estimated it at 20, compared to the at least 50 an ad of this complexity might typically entail ‚Äî such efficiencies mean that more could be done in a short amount of time. Brands will allocate the same budgets, Zada believes, leading perhaps to smaller teams on a given ad but more creative overall. ‚ÄúYou could do 10 times as much at scale,‚Äù he says. Whether Madison Avenue and Hollywood respond by doing more or just try to save money, however, remains to be seen. Coca-Cola's AI push can be seen as a way to increase its appeal among younger, more zeitgeist-y consumers as the company faces competition from boutique sodas and other upstart beverages. But it also, in the long run, could save the company cash, trimming at least some dollars off its reported $5 billion advertising budget. Madison Avenue executives of course generally are bracing for a potential significant downsizing in budgets as AI is deployed in areas from creative to research. Thakar, who says the company won't spend less money on advertising overall in the AI age, says he's taking a long view of what the tech can do, backlash and all. ‚ÄúLast year we decided to go all in, and it worked out well for us,‚Äù he says, noting that ‚Äúconsumer engagement was very high. Yes, some parts of the industry were not pleased we were using a 100 percent Generative AI film, but that's part and parcel of doing something pioneering,‚Äù he adds. ‚ÄúWe understand that concern. But we need to keep moving forward and pushing the envelope.‚Äù Thakar says the company was open to using it for activations in other times of the year, even high-impact ones like March Madness.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe genie is out of the bottle,‚Äù he says, ‚Äúand you're not going to put it back in.‚Äù Sign up for THR news straight to your inbox every day Subscribe for full access to The Hollywood Reporter Sign up for THR news straight to your inbox every day Send us a tip using our anonymous form.
WORLD NATIONAL BUSINESS CRYPTOCURRENCY SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY HEALTH SOCCER TENNIS FORMULA_1 ENTERTAINMENT OTHER


‚ÄòWicked: For Good' Star Jonathan Bailey Named ‚ÄòSexiest Man of the Year'
Source: Rolling Stone    Published: 2025-11-04 08:39:59

By Emily Zemler People has named British actor Jonathan Bailey as their ‚ÄúSexiest Man of the Year.‚Äù The news was revealed on The Tonight Show by host Jimmy Fallon, who called out Bailey's work this year in both Wicked: For Good and Jurassic World Rebirth. ‚ÄúIt's an honor of a lifetime,‚Äù Bailey told Fallon. ‚ÄúAnd I want to say, Jimmy, thank you so much for turning it down so that I could be here.‚Äù Fallon asked Bailey if it was difficult to keep the news a secret, but Bailey said it was ‚Äúsurprisingly not.‚Äù ‚ÄúBecause not that many people are going, ‚ÄòAre you‚Ä¶?'‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe're starting the Wicked press tour and I went away with some friends just before, just to get a bit of pal time. And we went out and we had a few drinks, and I was like, ‚ÄòGuys, guys.' I was like, ‚ÄòI'm the sexiest man alive.' And they were like, ‚ÄòYeah, yeah, do your affirmations.'‚Äù Fallon noted that Bailey is known as ‚Äúthe Internet's boyfriend.‚Äù He told Bailey that fans are always trying to cast him in various roles, including as the next James Bond and the next Batman. ‚ÄúOnly if you're by my side,‚Äù Bailey replied. ‚ÄúWill you be my Moneypenny?‚Äù Popular on Rolling Stone The actor also mentioned Wicked: For Good, which comes out later this month. ‚ÄúIt's like these extraordinary people who are utilizing a lifetime of craft,‚Äù Bailey said of the sequel. ‚ÄúAnd I think it will be one of my greatest honors to support Jon M. Chu. He's an incredibly visionary director. ‚Ä¶ It's going to be emotional for everyone, but it's going to be a beautiful thing, I think.‚Äù Trending Stories Bad Company Are No Longer Reuniting for Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Performance Grateful Dead Singer Donna Jean Godchaux Dead at 78 AC/DC Extend ‚ÄòPower Up' Tour With 2026 Dates Late-Night Hosts Take Aim at Trump's ‚ÄòGatsby' Party: ‚ÄòAs Dumb as You'd Expect' In his People cover story, Bailey shared his first celebrity crush (Prince Eric from The Little Mermaid) and said the last time he was moved to tears was watching Wicked: For Good. ‚ÄúBut beyond watching my own work, in a good way I get moved to tears by family quite a lot,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúLike my niece was pupil of the week, and I was just so proud of her. And she's the eldest of the next gen of Baileys. And that made me well up. In fact, all my sisters, when they send pictures of their kids‚ÄîI do find family does make me really emotional.‚Äù Wicked: For Good is set to arrive in theaters Nov. 21. It stars Ariana Grande as Glinda and Cynthia Erivo as Elphaba. Bailey plays Prince Fiyero, while Michelle Yeoh is Madame Morrible and Jeff Goldblum is the Wizard. The rest of the cast includes Marissa Bode, Ethan Slater, Bowen Yang, and Bronwyn James. We want to hear it. Send us a tip using our anonymous form. Halsey Shuts Down Audience Member for Telling Her to ‚ÄòStop Talking and Play'
Source: Rolling Stone    Published: 2025-11-04 08:13:18

By Emily Zemler Don't tell musicians what to do. Only hours after Halsey spent the night in the ER, she took the stage for her second night at Boston's MGM Music Hall. During the performance, as Halsey was addressing the crowd, a male audience member shouted, ‚ÄúStop talking and play.‚Äù ‚ÄúYou think you're tough shit because you're from Boston?‚Äù the singer replied. ‚ÄúI'm from Jersey, baby. I'll whoop your ass. My dad's from Boston, my mom's from Jersey‚Äîthat basically makes me a fucking demon. I'm gonna play whatever the fuck I wanna play. In case you didn't hear me correctly, I almost fucking died to be on this stage. I'm going to play whatever the fuck I wanna play.‚Äù Halsey claps back at rude fan @ Boston N2ü§™üòç #halsey #backtobadlands #boston #badlands #mgmmusichallfenway ‚ÄúI've been polite but won't be caught dead letting a man tell me what I should play in my set,‚Äù Halsey later wrote on X. She added, ‚ÄúThere's always one.‚Äù LIKE WHO FUCKING ASKED HIM pic.twitter.com/ZwJJLmjnDj He told me to ‚Äústop talking and play ____‚ÄùüôÑ there's always one https://t.co/75iwCTa2y9 Yesterday, Halsey updated fans on her health, explaining that she spent Sunday night in the emergency room after her first show in Boston. On Instagram Stories, the singer-songwriter said she had a ‚Äúminor medical emergency‚Äù after her first of two concerts. Although she was in the hospital's ER until six in the morning, Halsey told fans, ‚ÄúI am A-Okay now and ready to rock tonight!‚Äù Trending Stories Bad Company Are No Longer Reuniting for Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Performance Grateful Dead Singer Donna Jean Godchaux Dead at 78 AC/DC Extend ‚ÄòPower Up' Tour With 2026 Dates Late-Night Hosts Take Aim at Trump's ‚ÄòGatsby' Party: ‚ÄòAs Dumb as You'd Expect' Popular on Rolling Stone Halsey did not specify what put her in the emergency room, though she's been undergoing chemotherapy treatments recently after being diagnosed with lupus and a rare T-Cell lymphoproliferative disorder in 2022. On Instagram, Halsey thanked the doctors, nurses, and hospital staff who treated her at Mass General, calling them ‚Äúthe absolute best team I've ever met,‚Äù and adding, ‚ÄúI am so so grateful!‚Äù The musician is currently celebrating the 10th anniversary of her debut album on her Back to Badlands tour, which kicked off last month. She has additional shows across the U.S. scheduled through mid-November, with a second North American leg kicking off next January. Shows in Europe, the U.K., and Australia will follow. Halsey Shares Health Update After ‚ÄòMinor' Emergency Room Visit in Boston
Source: Billboard    Published: 2025-11-04 07:05:58

"Boston I'm gonna be honest with ya, after the show last night I was in the ER till 6 this morning," Halsey wrote. By Jessica Lynch Halsey is on the mend after spending the night in the emergency room following her Nov. 2 show in Boston. The singer-songwriter, who had a two-night stop in Boston for her international Back to Badlands tour, took to Instagram Stories on Sunday (Nov. 3) to share that she experienced a ‚Äúminor medical emergency‚Äù after her concert at MGM Music Hall. Despite the overnight ER stay, she confirmed she would be returning to the stage for her second Boston performance as scheduled. ‚ÄúBoston I'm gonna be honest with ya, after the show last night I was in the ER till 6 this morning,‚Äù Halsey wrote. ‚ÄúMinor medical emergency but I am A-Okay now and ready to rock tonight! But if I'm pacing myself, that's why!‚Äù She added a thank you to the hospital staff, calling them ‚Äúthe absolute best team I've ever met.‚Äù Related Diplo Jokes Jokes That Justin Trudeau Was 'The One That Got Away' After Addressing Past Katy Perry Romance Usher Reflects on How His 'Study' of Music's 'Legends' Helped Make Him One at Billboard Live Music Summit HUNTR/X's 'Golden,' From 'KPop Demon Hunters,' Shines With 14th Week Atop Global Charts Explore Halsey See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news The 31-year-old artist has been open about her ongoing health journey. In 2022, Halsey revealed she had been diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and a rare T-cell lymphoproliferative disorder, conditions that she says are now being managed or are in remission. ‚ÄúBoth of which I will likely have for the duration of my life,‚Äù she wrote in a June 2024 Instagram post. She also lives with endometriosis and previously shared she suffered a miscarriage while on tour at age 20. This latest health scare comes amid a particularly prolific era for the genre-blurring star. The Great Impersonator, released in October 2024 via Capitol Records, debuted at No. 2 on both the all-genre Billboard 200 and Top Album Sales charts. It also debuted atop Billboard's Top Rock & Alternative Albums and Top Alternative Albums charts. The set earned 93,000 equivalent album units in the United States in the week ending Oct. 31, according to Luminate. Halsey previously ruled Top Alternative Albums for a week each with If I Can't Have Love, I Want Power in 2021 and Badlands in 2015. Halsey has charted 20 songs on the Billboard Hot 100, including two No. 1 hits: her 2016 Closer collaboration with The Chainsmokers, which topped the chart for 12 weeks, and 2019's ‚ÄúWithout Me,‚Äù her first solo No. 1. She's also earned multiple top 10 albums on the Billboard 200, including Badlands (No. 2), Hopeless Fountain Kingdom (No. 1), Manic (No. 2), and If I Can't Have Love, I Want Power (No. 2). Bruce Dern Honors Ex-Wife Diane Ladd With Touching Tribute After Her Passing: 'Forever Grateful to Her'
Source: EntertainmentNow    Published: 2025-11-04 03:05:04

Bruce Dern is honoring the memory of his late ex-wife, legendary actress Diane Ladd, with a moving tribute following her passing at age 89. ‚ÄúDiane was a tremendous actress and I feel like, a bit of a ‚Äòhidden treasure' until she ran into David Lynch,‚Äù Dern, 89, shared in a statement to Us Weekly on November 3. ‚ÄúWhen he cast her as Laura's mom in ‚ÄòWild at Heart,' it felt like the world then really understood her brilliance. She was a great value as a decades-long board member of SAG, giving a real actress' point of view.‚Äù Ladd's daughter, actress Laura Dern, confirmed to The Hollywood Reporter that her mother had died peacefully at her home in Ojai, California. Her cause of death has not been publicly revealed. With his heartfelt words, Dern honored not only Ladd's remarkable career but also her remarkable spirit as an artist, mother, and advocate for fellow actors. In his statement, Dern reflected on Ladd's grace, humor, and deep devotion to her family. ‚ÄúShe lived a good life,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúShe saw everything the way it was. She was a great teammate to her fellow actors. She was funny, clever, gracious. But most importantly to me, she was a wonderful mother to our incredible wunderkind daughter. And for that I will be forever grateful to her.‚Äù Dern and Ladd were married from 1960 to 1969 and shared two daughters: Laura and Diane. Their firstborn, Diane, tragically died in 1962 after a drowning accident at just 18 months old, a loss that would shape both parents profoundly. Ladd spoke candidly about the heartbreak of losing her first child in her memoir Honey, Baby, Mine. ‚ÄúIf you lose a child, it's very hard to cope,‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúWe were struggling actors. We could hardly make it. We had to stay in the same house where she died because we couldn't afford to leave. His family could have helped us, but they didn't.‚Äù Ladd later married William A. Shea Jr. from 1969 to 1977 and found lasting love with Robert Charles Hunter, whom she married on Valentine's Day in 1999. The couple remained together until Hunter died in 2023. Despite their divorce, Ladd and Dern stayed close and even shared the screen multiple times, including in ‚ÄúThe Wild Angels,‚Äù ‚ÄúThe Rebel Rousers,‚Äù ‚ÄúMrs. Munck,‚Äù and ‚ÄúAmerican Cowslip.‚Äù In 2010, Ladd, Dern, and their daughter, Laura, made history as the first family to receive adjoining stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. At the ceremony, Ladd's acceptance speech captured her signature grace and gratitude. ‚ÄúI ask the universe that these three stars right here ‚Äî when I'm dead and gone or if I'm still alive ‚Äî that whoever comes and looks at it or stands on it, may the energy of the three of our lives permeate into their foundation and help each and every one fulfill their destiny with joy and love,‚Äù she said. The Dern couple are very talented character actor that made stars like Clint Eastwood look good. A real Hollywood family. Blake Lively makes new demands in harassment lawsuit as Justin Baldoni remains focused on trial
Source: Page Six    Published: 2025-11-04 02:30:00

Blake Lively filed a new motion demanding ‚ÄúIt Ends With Us‚Äù producer Jamey Heath hand over footage of his wife fully naked during a home-birth that she claims was shown to her ‚Äúwithout her consent or any warning in the workplace.‚Äù Lively, 38, accused Heath of showing her and an assistant the ‚Äúinappropriate‚Äù home-birth video of his wife, Natasha ‚Äî which the actress described as ‚Äúpornography.‚Äù The producer and her co-star/director, Justin Baldoni, allegedly showed the video in order to relay their vision of the birthing scene in the film. Advertisement The actress accused Heath of not abiding by an August court order that required him to produce the video in question, according to new court docs obtained by the Daily Mail. Advertisement In her motion filed on Oct. 30, Lively accused Heath of instead turning over a three-minute clip that was not the one she was shown on set. Lively demanded that a judge force him to hand over every version of the home-birthing video within three days of the court's order and to ban him from discussing it at trial if he doesn't comply. Both Lively's rep and Heath's rep didn't immediately respond to Page Six's request for comment. Heath and Baldoni previously hit back at her claims surrounding the video. In the now-dismissed complaint, they accused the actress of making an ‚Äúoutrageous and knowingly false suggestion that she was shown pornography or naked images of Heath's wife on set.‚Äù Advertisement Start your day with Page Six Daily. Please provide a valid email. By clicking above you agree to the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. Want celebrity news as it breaks? ‚ÄúTo characterize this image that captures such a beautiful moment with their newborn baby, shared with the consent of his wife for purposes of the Film, as a naked photo, or worse, ‚Äòporn,' is deplorable,‚Äù the complaint read. Advertisement On Friday, Baldoni's $400 million defamation and extortion countersuit against Lively and her husband, Ryan Reynolds, was officially ended by U.S. District Court Judge Lewis Liman. The judge's final judgment stated that Baldoni and his Wayfarer Studios co-plaintiffs declined to file an amended complaint, according to court documents obtained by Page Six. But Baldoni's legal team tells us he opted not to file an amended complaint so that he has the option to proceed with an appeal. Baldoni, meanwhile, remains focused on Lively's case, which will be tried in March 2026. Advertisement Lively made accusations surrounding the birthing scene in ‚ÄúIt Ends With Us‚Äù in her initial complaint and the amended version filed in February, both of which Page Six obtained. She said she was ‚Äúdisturbed‚Äù by many of Baldoni's actions on set, including ‚Äúnew scenes‚Äù he chose to have in the film, such as a ‚Äúviolative birthing scene for which he cast a friend as her OBGYN.‚Äù ‚ÄúMs. Lively felt that the selection of Mr. Baldoni's friend for this intimate role, in which the actor's face and hands were in close proximity to her nearly nude genitalia for a birth scene, was invasive and humiliating,‚Äù the complaint further alleged. But actor Adam Mondschein, who played the doctor in the scene, told Page Six that she never expressed discomfort while filming the scene, which he described as ‚Äúentirely professional.‚Äù ‚ÄúHer costume included a full hospital gown, black shorts and torso-covering prosthetic to make her appear pregnant in addition to whatever personal garments she chose,‚Äù he also alleged.

Shakira Receives Billboard's Global Touring Icon Award: ‚ÄòI Feel Like I'm Just Starting My Career'
Source: Billboard    Published: 2025-11-04 02:16:05

Her Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran World Tour is the highest-grossing Latin tour ever by a woman. By Jessica Roiz Assistant Editor, Latin Shakira received the inaugural Billboard Global Touring Icon Award in honor of her historic Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran World Tour, and as part of the 2025 Billboard Live Music Summit held Monday (Nov. 3) in West Hollywood, California. ‚ÄúAs your longtime tour manager, I am so proud and truly honored to present the first annual Billboard global icon tour award to you,‚Äù said tour director Marty Hom, who's also worked for Fleetwood Mac, Barbra Streisand and The Rolling Stones, among others. ‚ÄúWe get to witness every day how hard you work to do the best show possible for all your fans.‚Äù Shakira, who received the news backstage during the rehearsals of her recent show in Cali, Colombia, dedicated the award to her entire team, including dancers, band and crew, for ‚Äúworking as hard as I do,‚Äù she noted. The Live Nation-produced tour's first 64 dates (of 82) grossed $327.4 million and sold 2.5 million tickets, according to Billboard Boxscore, converting Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran into the highest grossing Latin tour ever by a woman and the second highest grossing Latin tour ever (behind only Luis Miguel's 2023-24 outing, which grossed $409.5 million). Additionally, the Colombian artist sold 65,000 tickets per night during her historic 12-concert run at Mexico City's Estadio GNP Seguros (formerly known as Foro Sol), according to promoter OCESA, for a total of 780,000 tickets sold. ‚ÄúIt's encouraging and inspiring,‚Äù Shakira said to Hom. ‚ÄúI never thought, not even in my wildest dreams, that I would fill every stadium. It's incredible and motivating at the same time, I feel like I'm just starting my career, and it's crazy because it's been 30 years ‚Ä¶ This has been the best tour of my life, it's been just as we dreamt it. We worked so hard, overcoming every obstacle, it hasn't been easy, we worked many, many long hours to make everything as good as people deserve it.‚Äù Backstage at her show in Cali ‚Äî where she performed for the first time in 20 years ‚Äî Shakira also discussed her personal life: ‚ÄúI'm completely dedicated to my boys and my career. That's all I need, my boys, my fans and my music, and creating, it's fulfilling a big part of my life right now.‚Äù Get weekly rundowns straight to your inbox A daily briefing on what matters in the music industry Send us a tip using our anonymous form. Hallmark Channel Stars & Fans Mourn Loss of Beloved Diane Ladd: ‚ÄòForever Our Gran'
Source: EntertainmentNow    Published: 2025-11-04 02:15:24

The news of legendary actress Diane Ladd's death on November 3, 2025, prompted an outpouring of love from Hollywood peers and admirers. Among those grieving Ladd's passing at 89 are her many Hallmark Channel co-stars and fans. Ladd appeared on all six seasons of Hallmark's ‚ÄúChesapeake Shores‚Äù from 2016 to 2022, playing beloved family matriarch Nell O'Brien, mother to the late Treat Williams' character, Mick O'Brien. Members of her Hallmark family quickly began paying tribute to the Golden Globe-winning actress after her real-life daughter, actress Laura Dern, announced her death. Meghan Ory, who played Abby O'Brien on ‚ÄúChesapeake Shores,‚Äù posted an Instagram photo of her, Ladd and Barbara Niven on the set and wrote above it, ‚ÄúLove you Diane ‚Ä¶ You had the best advice and the best stories. A true Icon. Rest in peace my friend.‚Äù With Sarah McLachlan's ‚ÄúAngel‚Äù playing in the background, Ory reiterated in her caption, ‚ÄúA true icon @rosedianeladd You will be greatly missed. Rest in peace ü™Ω‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù Emilie Ullerup, who played Bree O'Brien on the show, posted a photo in her Instagram Stories of Ladd with her on set, gently rubbing her temples. ‚ÄúWe lost a warrior today. Funny, wise, strong and full of light and life,‚Äù Ulleup wrote, and continued beneath the photo, ‚ÄúHere trying to heal my migraine between setups. Always one to help. ü§ç Rest easy my friend. You have earned it. (Though I'm certain you're already busy up there)‚Äù In June 2023, when Williams died in a tragic motorcyle accident, Ladd paid tribute to him on Instagram, posting a photo of them together and writing, ‚ÄúTreat Williams is one of our greatest actors and human beings. He was my Co-star in Hallmark's TV series, ‚ÄòChesapeake Shores' and a loved friend of mine & my daughter (co-starred in ‚ÄòSmooth Talk') who will be missed by us more than words can say!‚Äù Upon learning of Ladd's death, Williams' family shared two photos of her. Over one, they wrote, ‚ÄúSending love‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù and over another, of her with Williams, they wrote, ‚Äú‚ÄòWith the gifted Diane Ladd' ‚Äì T.W.‚Äù A ‚ÄúChesapeakes Shores‚Äù Instagram fan page that's still very active for its nearly 45,000 followers posted a tribute to Ladd that said, ‚ÄúIt's with heavy hearts that we share the news of the passing of our beloved Diane Ladd. Let's keep her family in our thoughts and prayers. Forever our Nell O'Briend.‚Äù In the account's stories, the administrators shared the post in their Stories and wrote, ‚ÄúForever our Gran! ü§ç‚Äù Many fans commented on the post, including one who wrote, ‚ÄúI am sad she is gone but relieved she is out of her earthly pain. She was a superb actress and I loved her in Chesapeake Shores!‚Äù Another fan shared, ‚ÄúBeautiful lady. May she rest in peace. Treat will be there to meet her at heavens gate üôèüíïüå∏‚Äù Comment Save my name, email, and website in this browser for the next time I comment. Œî Previous Next Like EntertainmentNow? Source: Page Six    Published: 2025-11-04 00:40:00

He's wicked hot. A source tells Page Six that Jonathan Bailey, who dazzled audiences with his dance moves playing Fiyero in the hit movie ‚ÄúWicked,‚Äù has been named this year's ‚ÄúSexiest Man Alive‚Äù by People magazine. A source tells us the big news will be announced Monday on ‚ÄúThe Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon.‚Äù Advertisement Bailey was on People's reader's choice list last year, when the mag allowed fans to vote on men by different categories, including ‚ÄúSexiest Fiyero.‚Äù Advertisement Along with defying gravity with his singing voice, Bailey also won hearts with his role on ‚ÄúBridgerton‚Äù as Lord Anthony Bridgerton. Fans have also loved the chemistry between Scarlett Johansson and Bailey, who is openly gay, as the two pals and co-stars smooched on the carpet and gave charismatic interviews for their flick ‚ÄúJurassic World Rebirth.‚Äù Advertisement This year marks the 40th Anniversary of People's special cover issue. Past winners have included Patrick Dempsey, John Legend, Channing Tatum, Ryan Reynolds, Dwayne the Rock Johnson, Denzel Washington, David Beckham and Matthew McConaughey. Paramount Taps Top Lionsgate Exec Shaun Barber to Run Domestic Theatrical Distribution
Source: The Hollywood Reporter    Published: 2025-11-04 00:30:58

Subscribe for full access to The Hollywood Reporter Subscribe for full access to The Hollywood Reporter Barber succeeds longtime domestic distribution boss Chris Aronson, who didn't survive the Skydance-Paramount merger. By Pamela McClintock Senior Film Writer David Ellison‚Äòs Paramount Pictures has found its new head of domestic theatrical distribution: Shaun Barber. He succeeds longtime domestic distribution boss Chris Aronson, who didn't survive the Skydance-Paramount merger. Barber officially arrives on the Paramount lot Dec. 1, and will work closely with international distribution chief Mark Viane. They'll both report directly to Josh Goldstine, the studio's newly installed president of global marketing and distribution. In turn, Goldstine reports to Paramount Pictures co-chairs Dana Goldberg and Josh Greenstein, who were hand-picked by Ellison to run the rearranged studio. Related Stories Business Paramount Sued By Exec Who Claims He Was Fired for Being White and Over 50 Business Paramount's No Good Very Bad Week The announcement of his hire comes just day after massive layoffs across the entire Paramount conglomerate, which Ellison said were necessary to facilitate changing priorities. Related Video Barber, a nearly 29-year industry veteran, will join Paramount from Lionsgate, where he served as co-president of worldwide theatrical distribution alongside Kevin Grayson (in separate news, THR has confirmed that Mike Viane ‚Äî Mark Viane's brother ‚Äî will be joining Lionsgate as executive vp of worldwide theatrical distribution and operations, reporting to Grayson). In his new gig at Paramont, Bauber will be in charge of North American distribution strategy and operations for all Paramoun releases. During his 18 years at Lionsgate and Summit Entertainment, Barber was instrumental in handling such blockbuster franchises as John Wick, The Hunger Games and Twilight, as well as critically acclaimed films including Knives Out, La La Land and The Hurt Locker (the latter won the Oscar for best picture). Under his leadership, films released through Lionsgate and Summit amassed over $9.3 billion in box office revenue. Barber began his career at 20th Century Fox in New York before moving to Los Angeles in 1998 to join Warner Bros., where he spent nearly a decade in theatrical distribution. ‚ÄúShaun is a deeply respected leader who has spent his career building meaningful partnerships across exhibition and the industry at large. He brings extensive expertise in domestic distribution strategy and will help us strengthen our theatrical business and deliver exceptional experiences for moviegoers,‚Äù Goldstine said in a statement. Added Barber, ‚ÄúI'm honored to join Paramount Pictures at this defining moment in its storied history. I look forward to collaborating with the exceptional team guiding the studio's next phase of growth. Together with our exhibition partners, we're committed to championing and elevating the power of the theatrical experience for audiences everywhere.‚Äù While the word ‚Äúdistributuion‚Äù couldn't be more boring, many of these execs are anything but, especially those working at a major studio side. Historically, they are the ones responsible for dealing with box office reporters on a movie's opening weekend and pushing a particular narrative, whether in good times or bad. And, depending on the structure, they are the ones interfacing directly with studio bosses, filmmakers, agents and talent when grosses start flowing in. .
